meanings.definition: To introduce semen into the reproductive tract of a female
meanings.sent1: The farmer inseminated the cow to help her have a calf.
meanings.sent2: The doctor inseminated the patient to assist in conception.
meanings.sent3: The scientist inseminated the plant with pollen to see if it would grow a new type of flower.
meanings.sent4: The bee inseminated the flower, unknowingly aiding in the process of pollination.
meanings.sent5: The artificial insemination process involves carefully inseminating the egg to increase the chances of successful fertilization.
